abstract: Danaher, a diversified toolmaker, said it will pay $1.1 billion for MDS’s instrument business in a move to add mass spectrometers to its offerings, The Associated Press reported.
snippet: Danaher, a diversified toolmaker, said it will pay $1.1 billion for MDS’s instrument business in a move to add mass spectrometers to its offerings, The Associated Press reported.
lead_paragraph: Diversified toolmaker Danaher said Wednesday it will pay $1.1 billion for MDS Inc.‘s instrument business in a move to add mass spectrometers to its offerings, while cutting an additional 3,300 jobs and closing 30 facilities, The Associated Press reported.

headline.main: Danaher Buying MDS, Life Technologies for $1.1 Billion
